plan: In the first few rounds, I'll test aggressive bidding by setting my bid slightly above my perceived value to gather data on opponents' strategies. In mid-rounds, I'll experiment with conservative bids, setting them slightly below my perceived value to assess risk. In later rounds, I'll apply a mixed strategy, adjusting bids based on observed patterns: if opponents bid high, I'll bid close to my perceived value; if they bid low, I'll bid slightly higher. Throughout, I'll track opponents' bid ranges to refine my strategy and maximize profit by winning at the lowest possible cost.

In the initial rounds, I'll test a conservative strategy by bidding slightly below my perceived value to gather data on competitors' bidding patterns. Mid-game, I'll switch to an aggressive strategy, bidding above my perceived value to test opponents' limits and assess risk. In the final rounds, I'll adjust my bids based on observed patterns, aiming to bid just above the second-highest perceived values to maximize profit. Throughout, I'll track common value estimates and competitors' bids to refine my understanding of their strategies and adapt accordingly for optimal long-term profit maximization.

In the initial rounds, I'll test a conservative strategy by bidding slightly below my perceived value to gauge opponents' bidding tendencies and gather data. Mid-game, I'll shift to an aggressive strategy, bidding above my perceived value to test if others are risk-averse. I'll also experiment with random high bids to potentially exploit low-bidding opponents. In later rounds, I'll adapt based on observed patterns, potentially employing a mixed strategy that combines aggressive and conservative elements. Throughout, I'll monitor bid distributions to refine my approach, aiming to maximize profit by balancing risk and reward.

Start with cautious bids slightly below your perceived value to gather data on competitors' bidding behavior. Gradually introduce variability by occasionally placing aggressive bids slightly above perceived value to test competitors' limits and reactions. Track patterns in opponents' bidding to identify any consistent strategies. In later rounds, adapt by either undercutting known aggressive bidders or exploiting conservative ones by bidding just above them. Adjust strategy based on observed tendencies, aiming to maximize profit by winning at the lowest possible cost. Balance risk and reward by continuously analyzing outcomes and refining approach based on observed bidding dynamics.
